studies.name: ENFORCER – Internet-based follow-up after out-of-hospital cardiac arrest
studies.population: Adult out-of-hospital cardiac arrest (OHCA) survivors with cognitive and/or emotional difficulties
studies.intervention: Comprehensive internet-based lifestyle, cognitive and emotional support programme after cardiac arrest

studies.name: V-CARE – Virtual care after resuscitation
studies.population: Cardiac arrest survivors and their relatives
studies.intervention: Virtual group psychoeducation + peer support for survivors and relatives
studies.follow_up: Multiple timepoints over several months after discharge

studies.name: ROCK – Return to work after out-of-hospital cardiac arrest
studies.intervention: Structured multidisciplinary rehabilitation pathway focusing on return to work
studies.follow_up: Follow-up for return-to-work and functional outcomes

studies.name: CARESSf – Community-based Aftercare and Rehabilitation for Cardiac Arrest Survivors and Families
studies.status: Feasibility study – in set-up / early delivery
studies.population: Cardiac arrest survivors and co-survivors soon after discharge
studies.intervention: Early online one-to-one and group education, exercise and support pathway for survivors and co-survivors
studies.follow_up: Feasibility outcomes over the early recovery period

studies.name: Effects of an Online Support Programme for Cardiac Arrest Survivors (CARDIS)
studies.population: Adult cardiac arrest survivors (≥18 years), 1–3 months after discharge with access to digital devices and sufficient Swedish
studies.design: Randomized controlled trial with pilot phase and process evaluation
studies.intervention: Co-created digital support programme with psychoeducation, recovery planning tools, exercises and moderated peer forum alongside usual follow-up
studies.comparator: Standard care (control group offered programme access after trial)
studies.follow_up: Digital consent and questionnaires at baseline, 3 months and 6 months
